Nicholas Hlobo bụ onye na-ese ihe na South Africa nke bi na Johannesburg, South Africa
A mụrụ ya n'afọ 1975 na Cape Town

O nwetara nzere bachelọ nke teknụzụ na Technikon Witwatersrand n'afọ 2002. Ọ na-emepụta nnukwu ọrụ ọkpụkpụ nke bụ ọtụtụ ihe dị ukwuu nke na-enwe mmetụta dị egwu, nke na-adọrọ adọrọ ma na-ahazi nke ọma
A na -emepụta ọdịiche nke nwanyị na nwoke site n'iji ihe ndị dị iche iche dị ka roba n'ime tube, ribbon, organza, lace na ihe ndị a chọtara.

Hlobo bụ onye mmeri nke 2006 Tollman Award for Visual Art, 2009 Standard Bank Young Artist Award, ọ bụ onye ikpeazụ maka Future Generation Art Prize 2010. N'afọ 2010, onye ndụmọdụ Sir Anish Kapoor họpụtara Hlobo dị ka onye na-echebe ya dịka akụkụ nke Rolex Mentor na Protégé Arts Initiative, mmemme enyemaka mba ụwa nke na-ejikọta ndị nna ukwu na ọzụzụ ha na talent na-apụta maka otu afọ nke mgbanwe okike otu onye.
E gosipụtara ọrụ Hlobo na Tate Modern na London, South African National Gallery, na Institute of Contemporary Art, Boston, n'etiti ọtụtụ ebe ndị ọzọ
E tinyekwara ọrụ ya na Havana Biennial nke afọ 2009 na Guangzhou Triennial nke afọ 2008

Hlobo bụ onye oji mbụ na-ese ihe nkiri nke Aardklop arts festival na Potchefstroom n'afọ 2008.
Nnukwu ihe ngosi nyocha nke ọrụ Hlobo dị na National Museum of Art, Architecture and Design na Oslo, Norway, site na 4 Machị ruo 29 Mee 2011

Hlobo na David Goldblatt bụ naanị ndị na-ese ihe abụọ South Africa nke onye nlekọta Bice Curiger kpọrọ ka ha gosipụta ọrụ na ogige mba ụwa IllUMinations nke 2011 Venice Biennale
A gụnyere ya na La Triennale 2012 na Paris na The Rainbow Nation, ihe ngosi nke ọgbọ atọ nke ihe ọkpụkpụ si South Africa, na Hague
A họpụtakwara ya maka Biennale nke iri na asatọ nke Sydney

N'afọ 2013 na 2014 ọrụ ya ga-apụta na ihe ngosi na Miami (Intethe), Aalborg (Out of Fashion : Textiles in International Contemporary Art), San Francisco (Public Intimacy : Art and other extraordinary Acts in South Africa) na The Divine Comedy
Heaven, Purgatory and Hell Revisited by Contemporary African Artists -Museum für Moderne Kunst (MMK), Frankfurt/Main
